snippet: Stronger demand for auto and student loans offset a drop in credit card debt, according to the Fed.
abstract: Federal Reserve reports consumer borrowing rose by $14.1 billion in November following a $16 billion increase in October, pushing consumer debt excluding real estate loans to $3.3 trillion, indicating that consumers have become more comfortable with debt amid economic recovery.
lead_paragraph: Stronger demand for auto and student loans offset a drop in credit card debt, according to the Fed.

headline.main: Student Loans and Car Sales Contribute to a Rise in Consumer Debt
headline.print_headline: Student Loans and Car Sales Contribute to a Rise in Consumer Debt
